metadata.title: CVE-2021-47448 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mptcp:fix possible stall on recvmsg() recvmsg() can enter an infinite loop if thecaller provides the MSG_WAITALL, the data present in the receive queue isnot sufficient to fulfill the request, and no more data is received by thepeer. When the above happens, mptcp_wait_data() will always return with nowait, as the MPTCP_DATA_READY flag checked by such function is set andnever cleared in such code path. Leveraging the above syzbot was able totrigger an RCU stall: rcu: INFO: rcu_preempt self-detected stall on CPUrcu: 0-...!: (10499 ticks this GP) idle=0af/1/0x4000000000000000softirq=10678/10678 fqs=1 (t=10500 jiffies g=13089 q=109) rcu: rcu_preemptkthread starved for 10497 jiffies! g13089 f0x0 RCU_GP_WAIT_FQS(5)->state=0x0 ->cpu=1 rcu: Unless rcu_preempt kthread gets sufficient CPUtime, OOM is now
